info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 17 at 4:33AM EST until January 17 at 12:00PM EST by NWS Albany
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON EST TODAY... * WHAT...Snow turning to sleet and freezing rain early this morning before becoming plain rain. Additional snow accumulations of 1 to 3 inches with the highest amounts in the Rensselaer Plateau. Ice accumulations of a light glaze. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph. * WHERE...Southern Litchfield County in northwestern Connecticut and the Capital District, Washington County, the Taconics, and Mid Hudson Valley in eastern New York. * WHEN...Until noon EST Monday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning commute. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches or isolated trees. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Additional upslope snow showers may return to the western slopes of the Taconics this evening producing an additional one to two inches of snow. Strong winds in areas mainly above 500 feet in elevation may result in isolated power outages.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling.
